fields.description:
Hi All,

In AWS one could detach the volume associated to an EBS backed instance when the instance is in 'stopped' state. Same behavior is not seen to be happening in Eucalyptus, it appears to be not implemented.

Kindly let me know if there are any questions or any specific logs are required for this bug.

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: Cannot detach EBS volume from stopped instance

comments.body:
Hey Deependra,

Can you attach the cloud logs from the SC, and the NC logs from the NC where the BFEBS instance was running?  I am thinking that the iscsi target is being left behind.  Additionally, can you supply the following outputs:

### From the SC:

tgtadm --op show --mode target

### From the NC:

iscsiadm -m session -P1

Thanks.  Please let us know if you have any additional questions.

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Hi Harold,

OK. So here is more details:

I have a CentOS 6.2 64bit EBS image

{code}
$ euca-describe-images
IMAGE	emi-13DA401E	387663223796/centos-6.2-x86-64	387663223796	available	public		x86_64	machine				ebs
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/vda	snap-81A1395D	5
{code}

I run an instance of that EBS backed EMI

{code}
$ euca-run-instances -k sshlogin -t c1.medium emi-13DA401E
{code}

I check the status of my instance

{code}
$ euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-2FD6431E	387663223796	default
INSTANCE	i-A1993B56	emi-13DA401E	euca-192-168-61-40.nirvana.euca.jeevanullas.in	euca-10-10-191-51.nirvana.internal	running	sshlogic1.medium	2012-07-06T10:50:10.406Z	jeevan-cloud	eki-C3543BD6			monitoring-disabled	euca-192-168-61-40.nirvana.euca.jeevanullas.in	euca-10-10-191-51.nirvana.internal			ebs		
{code}

I check the status of the volumes

{code}
$ euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-25413E6E	 5		jeevan-cloud	available	2012-07-01T03:45:17.577Z
VOLUME	vol-147D3FDC	 5	snap-81A1395D	jeevan-cloud	deleted	2012-07-06T08:50:46.691Z
VOLUME	vol-456E3CC3	 5	snap-81A1395D	jeevan-cloud	available	2012-07-06T08:32:54.183Z
VOLUME	vol-859C3C00	 5	snap-81A1395D	jeevan-cloud	in-use	2012-07-06T10:50:10.5Z
ATTACHMENT	vol-859C3C00	i-A1993B56	/dev/sda1	attached	2012-07-06T10:50:10.597Z
{code}

I stop the EBS backed instance,

{code}
$ euca-stop-instances i-A1993B56
INSTANCE	i-A1993B56
{code}

I check the status of the instance

{code}
$ euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-2FD6431E	387663223796	default
INSTANCE	i-A1993B56	emi-13DA401E	euca-192-168-61-40.nirvana.euca.jeevanullas.in	euca-10-10-191-51.nirvana.internal	stopped	sshlogic1.medium	2012-07-06T10:50:10.406Z	jeevan-cloud	eki-C3543BD6			monitoring-disabled	euca-192-168-61-40.nirvana.euca.jeevanullas.in	euca-10-10-191-51.nirvana.internal			ebs
{code}

I check the status of the volume

{code}
$ euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-25413E6E	 5		jeevan-cloud	available	2012-07-01T03:45:17.577Z
VOLUME	vol-456E3CC3	 5	snap-81A1395D	jeevan-cloud	available	2012-07-06T08:32:54.183Z
VOLUME	vol-859C3C00	 5	snap-81A1395D	jeevan-cloud	in-use	2012-07-06T10:50:10.5Z
ATTACHMENT	vol-859C3C00	i-A1993B56	/dev/sda1	attached	2012-07-06T10:50:10.597Z
{code}

I detach the volume vol-859C3C00 as its now not been used (the instance i-A1993B56 is stopped)

{code}
$ euca-detach-volume vol-859C3C00
{code}

Now I again check the status of the volume

{code}
$ euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME	vol-25413E6E	 5		jeevan-cloud	available	2012-07-01T03:45:17.577Z
VOLUME	vol-456E3CC3	 5	snap-81A1395D	jeevan-cloud	available	2012-07-06T08:32:54.183Z
VOLUME	vol-859C3C00	 5	snap-81A1395D	jeevan-cloud	in-use	2012-07-06T10:50:10.5Z
ATTACHMENT	vol-859C3C00	i-A1993B56	/dev/sda1	attached	2012-07-06T10:50:10.597Z
{code}

So it didn't detach the volume as it does in AWS.

Now logs (nc.log for the instance and cloud-output.log/cloud-debug.log/cloud-error.log) are attached with this ticket and the output requested is shown below

On the storage controller

{code}
$ tgtadm --op show --mode target
Target 1: iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.jeevan-cloud:store1
    System information:
        Driver: iscsi
        State: ready
    I_T nexus information:

        LUN: 0
            Type: controller

            Backing store flags: 
    Account information:
        eucalyptus
    ACL information:
        ALL
Target 2: iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.jeevan-cloud:store2
    System information:
        Driver: iscsi
        State: ready
    I_T nexus information:
    LUN information:
        LUN: 0
            Type: controller
            SCSI ID: IET     00020000
            SCSI SN: beaf20
            Size: 0 MB, Block size: 1
            Online: Yes
            Removable media: No
            Readonly: No
            Backing store type: null
            Backing store path: None
            Backing store flags: 
        LUN: 1
            Type: disk
            SCSI ID: IET     00020001
            SCSI SN: beaf21
            Size: 5369 MB, Block size: 512
            Online: Yes
            Removable media: No
            Readonly: No
            Backing store type: rdwr
            Backing store path: /dev/vg-RBVxmA../lv-dGjwSw..
            Backing store flags: 
    Account information:
        eucalyptus
    ACL information:
        ALL
Target 4: iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.jeevan-cloud:store4
    System information:
        Driver: iscsi
        State: ready
    I_T nexus information:
    LUN information:
        LUN: 0
            Type: controller
            SCSI ID: IET     00040000
            SCSI SN: beaf40
            Size: 0 MB, Block size: 1
            Online: Yes
            Removable media: No
            Readonly: No
            Backing store type: null

            Backing store flags: 
        LUN: 1
            Type: disk
            SCSI ID: IET     00040001
            SCSI SN: beaf41
            Size: 5369 MB, Block size: 512
            Online: Yes
            Removable media: No
            Readonly: No
            Backing store type: rdwr
            Backing store path: /dev/vg-x0TlaA../lv-3hej8A..

{code}

On the node controller

{code}
$ iscsiadm -m session -P1
iscsiadm: No active sessions.
{code}



Let me know if you have any questions, this behavior is reproducible at will.

Cheers!
Deependra
Logs as requested from storage controller and node controller
No need for additional clarification.  Tier 3 was able to reproduce.

Reopening ticket.  Was able to successfully create issue on 3.2.1.
Starting investigation.  Will provide steps for reproduction.

Confirmed.

*Steps for reproduction*

* Create BFEBS image

I think the fix for this issue was reverted from 3.2.2. AFAIK the issue is not entirely addressed in 3.3. Detaching a volume associated with EBS backed instances at boot time is not allowed in 3.3. This was only a temporary fix in place to avoid jacking up the instance (as it used to before). The AWS compatibility fix for this bug is being targeted for 3.4 (hopefully).

Change this from a bug to a new feature request after talking with [~chuck]. This is an AWS feature that Eucalyptus has never supported. The changes required to support it are non-trivial (particularly for the root volume), so we need to address it as a new feature/improvement rather than a bug fix.

The specifically difficult issue is detaching the root volume of an ebs-instance. The current boot record structure was not intended for manipulation of the root volume record other than at instance construction and termination.

I think we should actually track this by creating a story and planning it in the release schedule if this is a high priority issue.
This *maybe* fixed in 4.0. Definitely not in 3.4.0

[~swathi], during your investigation, we need to know the impact of the change.  It appears that it will affect tools, storage, and upgrade.  Let us know the findings so we can properly target the fix

[~tjcramer], I remember investigating this for 3.3 when we made other improvements to EBS backed instances. EC2 allows detaching non-root volumes from EBS backed instances when the instance is running. We don't support this either as of today, in general we don't support attach/detach operations on boot time (root and non-root) volumes from EBS backed instances. We decided to address these bugs and others with a bigger change to re-architect the volume attachments in the CLC and the NC - not differentiate between boot time volumes and other volumes in the CLC, store all volume attachments in the same consistent way on the NC, change the messages from CLC to NC. It was not scoped for earlier releases as it involved multiple teams, and the issue was not prioritized. 

Short of the ideal solution, we might be able to partially address the issue i.e. attach/detach volumes when the EBS backed instance is stopped as it involves changes only at the CLC. I think it might require some database tinkering and I'll have to investigate that further.
